title: Corruption in Public Services
summary: Citizens face bribery demands when accessing basic public services like getting documents, permits, or utilities connected.
currentSituation: According to surveys, over 60% of citizens report paying bribes for public services. Common areas include passport offices, land offices, utility connections, and law enforcement. Average households spend significant amounts on unofficial payments annually.
consequences: Increased cost of living for ordinary citizens
Erosion of public trust in institutions
potentialTechInterventions: Automated approval systems to reduce discretion
